item.description:
Location: Waltham-Westin Hotel, 70 Third Avenue, Waltham, MA 02451

Massachusetts Health Council, Inc

Presents


13th Annual Pharmacy Public Health Policy Symposium




7:30 a.m. – 8:25 a.m. Registration and Coffee


8:25 a.m. - 8:30 a.m. Welcome and Remarks


•Susan Servais, Executive Director, MA Health Council
•Katherine Keough, Co-Chair MHC Pharmacy Access Committee
Government Relations Manager, Atrius Health



8:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m. Is the Medicine Cabinet Contributing to Teenage Drug Abuse: Educating parent-patients on preventing access to their prescription drugs

•Steve Pasierb, President and CEO, The Partnership for a Drug Free America
•Nancy Coffey, Diversion Program Manager, New England Field Division, US Drug Enforcement Administration

9:30 a.m. – 10:30 a.m. Make Your Patient Your Best Friend: Effective Communication Skills for Pharmacists

•Helen Meldrum, EdD, Associate Professor of Psychology, Program in Health Sciences and Industry, Bentley University, Waltham, MA



10:30 a.m. - 10:45 a.m. Break



10:45 a.m. – 11:45 a.m. Burprenorphine Treatment in Addiction: What a Pharmacist Needs to Know


•Harriet Scheft, MD, Addiction Psychiatrist, Harvard Vanguard Medical Associates


12:00 noon – 1:00 p.m. Lunch/Exhibits


1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m. Taking Collaborative Drug Therapy Management and Medication Therapy Management from Theory into Practice


•Tracey Cole, PharmD, Pharmacy Director, Holyoke Health Center
•Joseph Calomo, PharmD, Director of Pharmacy Services, Northeast Rehabilitation Hospital


2:00 p.m. – 4:00 p.m. Regulatory/Legislative Update


•Michael Tocco, RPh, M.Ed., President, Integrated Pharmacy Solutions, member, Massachusetts Board of Registration in Pharmacy
•Paul Jeffrey, PharmD, Deputy Director, Office of Clinical Affairs, Commonwealth Medicine, Director of Pharmacy, MassHealth
•Alice Bonner, Assistant Commissioner, Ph.D., RN, Division of Health Care Quality and Safety, MA Department of Public Health
•Grant Carrow, PhD, Deputy Director, Center for Quality Assurance and Control, MA Department of Public Health

4:05 p.m. – 4:15 p.m. Awarding of Certificates


***You must be present to receive certificates. Certificates will not be mailed.



TOTAL C.E.U. CREDITS APPROVED = 0.65 contact hours (includes .2 live law)

No refunds.

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION, CALL the MHC Office (617) 965-3711.
item.name: Babson 8th Annual Healthcare & Life Sciences Forum
